Class HighScore

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • HighScore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class HighScore
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This manages and manipulates the highscore of the game. The highscore will be dispalyed on the JPanel through a JLabel.
    Version:
    2.3, May 16th, 2014
    Author:
    Richard Dang and Benson Guo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighScore

        public HighScore()
        Constructor which sets up the JPanel for the highscores. The layout is set to null. Sets up the background, guis, highscore ArrayLists, and diaplays the highscores.

    • Method Detail

      • drawBackground

        public void drawBackground()
        This method reads the image used for the background of the panel.
        Parameters:
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • readHighscore

        public void readHighscore()
        The readHighscore method reads the highscore list from a text file ("Highscore.rbcs") with Scanner. The text is read within a try block to catch for IOExceptions and NoSuchElementExceptions. If the header is not valid, a new highscore file will be created.
        Parameters:
        s-reference - variable for Scanner.
        x-int - variable for loop to read text.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException and NoSuchElementException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading from highscore file.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - Thrown to indication a error when reading from highscore file.

      • createHighscoreFile

        public void createHighscoreFile()
        Creates a new highscore with extension rbcs, and a header.
        Parameters:
        e-variable - to catch for IOException and NoSuchElementException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when writing to file.

      • saveHighscore

        public void saveHighscore()
        The saveHighscore method saves the highscore list to a text file ("Highscore.rbcs") with PrintWriter. The text is written within a try block to catch for IOExceptions.
        Parameters:
        out-reference - variable for PrintWriter.
        x-int - variable for loop to write text.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when writing to highscore file.

      • insertScore

        public void insertScore(int score,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String level)
        The insertScore method inserts a score into the highscores, if the score is high enough, which is checked with an if statement. The loop goes through the ArrayList of scores from highest to lowest, and inserts at the index if the new score is higher. If the score is lower than the 10th score, than no action is done. The panel is updated with the new highscores.
        Parameters:
        x-int - variable for loop to go through score ArrayList.
        score-int - variable passed in for score.
        name-String - variable passed in for player name.
        level-String - varaible passed in for level.

      • displayHighscore

        public void displayHighscore()
        The displayHighscore method displays the highscore list on the panel. The title and header JLabels and set to the required locations. A for loop goes through the 3 instance ArrayLists and displays the score information on the screen through a JLabel. An if statement checks to ensure that the highscore file is not corrupted.
        Parameters:
        scoreName-reference - variable for JLabel for score information.
        rank-int - varaible for rank.
        font-reference - variable for Font of score information.
        x-int - variable for for loop.
        y-int - variable for for loop.
        z-int - variable for for loop.

      • highscoreOptions

        public void highscoreOptions()
        The highscoreOptions method sets up the background and buttons.
        Parameters:
        print-BufferedImage - variable for print button.
        returns-BufferedImage - variable for return to menu button.
        reset-BufferedImage - variable for reset highscore button.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Implemented abstract method that prints the highscore or returns to menu based on the button that is clicked, through and if statement.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae-ActionEvent - variable passed in.

      • resetHighscores

        public void resetHighscores()
        The resetHighscores method resets the highscore list and panel.

      • printHighscore

        public void printHighscore()
        This method prints the highscore list. It creates a Print class coded by Daniel Chen and prints a list of the highscores. The printed text is formatted for for loops.
        Parameters:
        p-reference - variable for Print class.
        x-int - counter variable for loop.
        y-int - counter variable for loop.
        line-String - variable to store a line to be printed.
        rank-String - variable to store the rank of a score.
